name: Red Poppy
climate: Red Poppies thrive in temperate climates with mild summers.
They are also found in Mediterranean climates with rainy winters.
This plant prefers environments with low humidity and good air flow.
Red Poppies can endure some drought in continental climate regions.
sunlight: Red Poppies require full sun for optimal blooming performance.
They need at least 6 hours of direct sunlight for healthy growth.
Partial shade can be tolerated but will reduce the flowering.
In hot climates, light afternoon shade is beneficial for Red Poppies.
watering: Red Poppies need moderate watering to thrive successfully.
Soil should be kept evenly moist but not waterlogged for best results.
Water deeply but infrequently to encourage strong root development.
During drought periods, additional watering helps maintain flower production.
soil: Well-draining soil is essential for the growth of Red Poppies.
They prefer sandy or loamy soil types with good aeration properties.
A neutral to slightly alkaline soil pH is ideal for the plant's health.
Avoid heavy clay soils as they tend to retain too much water.
toxic: Red Poppies contain alkaloids that can be toxic if ingested by humans and animals.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent flowers regularly to encourage more blooms and prevent excessive self-seeding.
